identificationModule.briefTitle: Brachial Artery Pulsatility Index in Supraclavicular Block
identificationModule.officialTitle: Evaluation of Brachial Artery Pulsatility Index as a Predictor of Successful Supraclavicular Block: a Prospective Observational Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary: we aimed to evaluated accuracy of brachial artery doppler derived indices such as change in pulsatility index, resistive index, and waveform morphology in predicting successful supraclavicular block
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
supraclavicular brachial plexus block gives adequate anesthesia and analgesia for arm and hand surgeries. successful block was tradtionaly evaluated via assessment of both sensory and motor functions, However this carry disadvantages of subjective assessment including patient cooperation. objective monitors of successful block depend on sympasthetic mediated changes including perfusion index, thermography, and LASER doppler.

However most of these tools depend on complicated technology and special devices.

we therefore assumed that the use of brachial artery derived indices such as pulsatility index, resistive index, and waveform morphology would provide simple, easy and economic assessment tool for successful supraclavicular brachial plexus block

interventions.name: brachial artery doppler
interventions.description: brachial artery doppler evaluation before and after supraclavicular block

primaryOutcomes.measure: the change in pulsatility index as a predictor to successful supraclavicular block
primaryOutcomes.description: the difference between the index before and after the block divided by the index value before the block
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline and at 5 minutes interval after block for 30 minutes

secondaryOutcomes.measure: change in resistive index as a predictor for successful block
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline then at 5 minutes interval for 30 minutes

secondaryOutcomes.measure: change in waveform morphology as a predictor to successful block
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline and within 10 minutes of block

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

- ASA 1 undergoing forearm or hand surgery

Exclusion Criteria:

* patient refusal allergy to local anesthetics fracture humerus Diabetes Melitus peripheral vascular disease
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: adult patient, ASA 1 and will receive supraclavicular brachial plexus block for forearm or hand surgery
